school: School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences
vision_mission_university: We envision Saint Louis University as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
vision_mission_school: The School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences envisions itself as a seat of excellence in Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences education. It is dynamic and inspired by a Christian way of living, producing globally competitive and value-laden nurses and healthcare professionals in service of humanity.
peo_christian_spirit: Practice the values of true Christian living based on the Code of Ethics for Medical Technologists.
peo_creativity: Engage in scholastic and technical activities in health and scientific research.
peo_competence: Demonstrate technical competence in clinical laboratory procedures for diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of diseases.
peo_social_involvement: Show leadership and responsibility in addressing individual and community health problems through quality laboratory services.
plo_1: Integrate knowledge of physical, social, natural, chemical, humanities, and health sciences in providing quality service in the practice of Medical Laboratory Science.
plo_2: Communicate effectively orally and in writing using English and Filipino with cultural sensitivity when interacting with peers, students, patients, and other health care professionals.
plo_3: Demonstrate technical competence (safe, appropriate, and accurate testing) in performing laboratory tests to aid in diagnosis, treatment, and management of diseases.
plo_4: Engage in Medical Laboratory Science-related collaborative and innovative research, extension, and outreach programs that promote community health.
plo_5: Apply analytical and critical thinking skills in making sound judgments on implausible laboratory results and take appropriate action.
plo_6: Demonstrate dedication, commitment, and management skills in laboratory operations to deliver quality services.
plo_7: Engage in lifelong learning for professional advancement to remain globally and technologically competent.
plo_8: Work effectively and independently in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams while preserving and promoting Filipino historical-cultural heritage.
plo_9: Demonstrate professional, social, and ethical responsibility for environmental protection through proper biosafety and waste management.
plo_10: Practice principles of accountability (relevance, equality, equity, quality, and cost-effectiveness) in delivering healthcare to patients, families, and communities.
plo_11: Apply the latest developments in Medical Laboratory Science ethically and responsibly.
curriculum_year_4: Internship Year: SLU Clinical Laboratories, Affiliate Laboratories, International Internship at Huachiew Chalermprakiet University (HCU), Thailand
admission_shifters_conditions: No record of failure or drop, GWA â‰¥ 85%
cross_enroll_gen_ed: Allowed if units and descriptions match
career_clinical_diagnostic_1: Special Laboratory Scientist (e.g., Blood Bank, Cytotechnologist, Hematologist)
contact_office: Room 402, 4th Floor, Rizal Building, Saint Louis University, Bonifacio St., Baguio City
